page.title: 18HOME LIFE AROUND SHALBOURNE
page.content: Shalbourne still has its own shop, pub, garage and church, but except for the latter each is the only one for three miles. Families shop locally for daily needs but tend to visit shops in nearby towns for bulk buying. About 70% have{freezers}for convenience foods and bulk, home-prepared items. {Many women work.}All houses have {running water}from farm wells or the Water Authority. All have{electricity. Only bottled gas is available.{Heating is mainly oil or coal but logs are available.{Gardens}average 0.1 ha. The village hall/clubs provide facilities for games and drama.{Audio/television, live or recorded, are in most homes. Probably one house in three has a{dog and similar number a{cat,}though in a pheasant-shooting area cats are not popular. Several people keep{horses}or ponies as grazing is available.
